desc: Let's look at a basic example. This example should be familiar(and predictable) to just about anyone with a bit of programming experience:
code: function() {	 var a = 10;	 if (a > 5) {		 a = 7;	 }	 alert(a);}

question.content: When executed, what Value will be alerted to the screen?

explains: What happens here is exactly as you might expect. You declare a local variable and set its value to 10. Its value is indeed greater than 5, so you set its value to 7. You then alert this new value, 7
